{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3501673,"name":"Yahya Burak","username":"FRC-ITOBOT","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frc-itobot/{size}/248565_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T13:42:17.506Z","cooked":"

First of all, hello everyone, we use swerve mk4i and neo engines and accordingly, the code infrastructure we use is Yagsl. And this year, Yagsl published a new template as 2025 code. But while our code and wheels were working smoothly in last year’s template, in this year’s code, we set the same pid settings and absolute encoder offsets to the same robot, but despite this, the wheels move independently of themselves and when I try to drive and give the forward command, all of the wheels are facing inwards and the robot turns to one, while it should turn to one. It is not acting stable and as it should. What is the solution to this? Can anyone help?

here our github code GitHub - safeapric0t/itobotswerve

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-02-04T13:42:17.506Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":53,"reads":153,"readers_count":152,"score":295.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":485130,"topic_slug":"yagsl-2025-not-working-well","display_username":"Yahya Burak","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/safeapric0t/itobotswerve","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - safeapric0t/itobotswerve","clicks":10}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71491,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-2025-not-working-well/485130/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3501749,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T15:01:32.198Z","cooked":"

This is not an uncommon issue (even in 2024) and is normally the result of you mislabeling the cardinal directions of the robot while configuring them. It is documented and can be fixed by swapping modules around so they point the correct direction. Here is the page on that documentation.

docs.yagsl.com

Configuration | YAGSL

You’re doing fine! Would you like to get on a call so i can walk you through how to do this step?

If you click on the link you will see this diagram.

image1046×420 25 KB

This is something that happens when you mislabel your front side of the robot, which happens if your gyro isnt facing straight.

You also need to update to YAGSL 2025.3.0 which i released on Saturday. It shouldn’t affect you much but i prefer it when teams are on the latest version incase i need to make any changes

I just took a good look at your code and noticed a few of your modules had an inversion while others dont and it looks like you’re using all the same modules.
Your PIDF values looked like you tuned them yourself (which isn’t bad, but remember that PID values vary between robots bc no 2 robots have the same weight. You said that you used this last year, but i don’t think you competed with just a drivetrain last year)

All of my changes are in this PR. Merge it or not it doesnt matter. You just need to test with this first.

github.com/safeapric0t/itobotswerve

Update for fixes

safeapric0t:main ← thenetworkgrinch:patch-1
opened 05:55PM - 04 Feb 25 UTC
thenetworkgrinch
+14 -14

I used the data you gave and with a small adjustment, the swerve wheels are working successfully, but currently the data coming from the joystick is reversed. I am currently working on this and there is a shift in the axis while moving straight, that is, its head gradually turns to another place, I will solve this. However, the system I have created is not field oriented, that is, it not allows the robot to rotate around its own axis while moving in a linear plane at the same time. I cannot provide it, there are many variables such as alliencerelativeControl and headingState in the code part, I think this is the problem because last year’s robot could rotate around itself while moving straight, but we cannot achieve such a thing with our current infrastructure, I would be very happy if you can help.
